sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Innocencie vindicated. Or, A brief answer to part of a scandalous paper, entituled A true narrative of the occasion and causes of the late Lord General Cromwel's anger against Lieutenant Colonel Joyce, &c. And his proceedings against him, to cashier him from the Army. By Jo. Rix, once lieutenant to the said Lt. Colonel Joyce. Rix, John.
[2], 6 p.
by J.C., Printed at London : 1659.
A reply to part of the work by Joyce. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June. 28". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Innocencie vindicated. Or, A brief answer to part of a scandalous paper, entituled A true narrative of the occasion and causes of the late Lord General Cromwel's anger against Lieutenant Colonel Joyce, &c. And his proceedings against him, to cashier him from the Army. By Jo. Rix, once lieutenant to the said Lt. Colonel Joyce. Rix, John.
[2], 6 p.
by J.C., Printed at London : 1659.
A reply to part of the work by Joyce. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June. 28". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
J.C.
